alert.note: Alert for Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 8:36AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Georgia and upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, in northeast Georgia, Franklin and Stephens. In upstate South Carolina, Oconee. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 AM EDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Be wary of elevated and rising stream flows thoughout the Tugaloo River basin and the upper arm of Lake Hartwell. Watch for urban flooding issues around greater Toccoa and the highway 17 corridor in Stephens County. Also, keep tabs on flooding issues along the highway 76 corridor in Oconee. A smattering of high water conditions will likely develop across greater Walhalla, Seneca and Clemson as well. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Toccoa, Seneca, Walhalla, Carnesville, Westminster, Lavonia, Gumlog, Martin, Avalon, Tallulah Falls, Tugaloo State Park, Tallulah Gorge State Park, Lake Hartwell, Lake Keowee, Eastanolee, Boydville, Oakway and Long Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
